data.title: Big List of Resources
data.summary: A huge list of resources for players and DMs alike.
data.PostMarkdown:
# Big List of Resources

Here's a list oflinks that I find inspiring when I create adventures and characters. It's super big yet, but I’m always adding stuff! For now, I’m keeping this list to things that I’ve used/watched/listened to and can personally recommend. 

[Shoot me an email](mailto:hello@gaininspiration.com) if you think I should add something and I’ll check it out.

## Videos

### For DMs  
**[Matthew Colville’s Running the Game Series](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLlUk42GiU2guNzWBzxn7hs8MaV7ELLCP)** 
A YouTube playlist that takes you through every aspect of, well, running the game of D&D. For new DMs and veterans alike. And players too for that matter.  

**[MrRhexx’s Dungeons and Dragons Lore Series](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL-Tj3kmYOOy2OVjoqTO8joausM-6JjcI-)**  
A YouTube playlist that dives deep into the lore of Waterdeep and beyond. Way beyond. Great for all the little details like why gold dragons have whiskers.  

**[Zee Bashew’s The Cold Road D&D Campaign Diary](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLuNLwLRy7g-gKWlmo3mgr6U57lNU66Bga)**  
Super fun campaign setting and a great look behind the scenes at how a great DM adapts to character actions.  

### For Players  
**[Any video from Runesmith](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCweFJojRAFuxyYxe4KHL8vw/featured)**  
Funny videos from a dude you just wanna be friends with. He doesn't go super in-depth, but he tells you what you need to know and he’ll make you laugh along the way.

**[JoCat’s Crap Guide to D&D Series](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLDnRMnDDjAzK5uZLidDUtHtD1iN06Qe0G)**  
Insanely creative and fun videos that make for great beginner’s explanations. Keeps everything accessible and fun. Like D&D should be.

**[Zee Bashew’s The Animated Spellbook](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLuNLwLRy7g-gKWlmo3mgr6U57lNU66Bga)**  
A gorgeously animated guide to spells and how to use them. And how not to use them. 
## Generators
### Maps
**[Watabou’s Medieval Fantasy City Generator](https://watabou.itch.io/medieval-fantasy-city-generator)**  
A great little generator that provides a deceptively large amount of control. 

**[Watabou’s Toy Town](https://watabou.itch.io/toy-town)**  
A tool that visualizes your medieval fantasy city into a 3D model you can walk around in!
### Books
**[Madeline Hale’s Table Fables](https://www.amazon.com/Table-Fables-collection-tables-master/dp/1542678595) and [Table Fables 2](https://www.amazon.com/Table-Fables-II-World-Builders-Handbook/dp/1983428000/ref=pd_sbs_14_img_0/132-6435579-3836508)**  
The first Table Fables is fantastic for in-game randomized fun. The second one is great for planning your next sesh.  
## Podcasts
**[Brian Posehn’s Nerd Poker (Old)](https://www.earwolf.com/show/nerd-poker/)**
This podcast got me into D&D. You need Stitcher Premium to listen now, but I think the first half is worth a listen if you haven’t heard it yet.

**[Brian Posehn’s Nerd Poker (New)](https://nerdpokerpod.com/)**
A revival of the classic and a ton of fun. Just a bunch of old friends playing D&D together.  

**[GeeklyInc’s ~~Drunks & Dragons~~ Greetings Adventurers](https://geeklyinc.com/category/drunks-and-dragons/)**  
This is my all-time favorite D&D podcast. It took me from “Huh, D&D is kinda cool.” to “I have to play this right now.” Listen to them all if you can. If you can’t, they have some abridged episodes available. 

**[The McElroys The Adventure Zone](https://maximumfun.org/podcasts/adventure-zone/)**  
I was late to the party on this one, but I made it! It’s a lot of fun and the McElroys come up with great in-game mechanics to keep things moving along.  

**[Dungeons & Daddies](https://dungeonsanddaddies.com/)**  
Stop what you’re doing and listen to this podcast right now. You will thank me.

**[Critical Role](https://critrole.com/)**  
Don’t hate me, but I’ve never actually listened to Critical Role. But I would be remiss if I didn’t acknowledge its impact on D&D and nerd culture as a whole.  

**[Imaginary Worlds](https://www.imaginaryworldspodcast.org/)**
Not D&D focused, but a great look into geek culture, world building and what makes this all so engrossing.
